trans-unit.source: Configure EDI Receive bridge settings in BizTalk Services Portal
trans-unit.target: Configure EDI Receive bridge settings in BizTalk Services Portal

trans-unit.source: Configure an EDI receive bridge in <token>af_integration</token>.
trans-unit.target: Configure an EDI receive bridge in <token>af_integration</token>.

trans-unit.source: The EDI receive bridge configuration includes settings including which transport to use for receiving messages, any transforms to use while processing the message, and routing rules/destinations.
trans-unit.target: The EDI receive bridge configuration includes settings including which transport to use for receiving messages, any transforms to use while processing the message, and routing rules/destinations.

trans-unit.source: Configure the Transport
trans-unit.target: Configure the Transport

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Transport</ui> page, you enter the transport settings used between the two partners.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Transport</ui> page, you enter the transport settings used between the two partners.

trans-unit.source: The <token>tpm_portal</token> supports HTTP, FTP, SFTP, and AS2 transports.
trans-unit.target: The <token>tpm_portal</token> supports HTTP, FTP, SFTP, and AS2 transports.

trans-unit.source: From the <embeddedLabel>Receive Settings</embeddedLabel> tab, you can also promote properties from the SOAP and HTTP headers on the received message that can later be used during the agreement processing.
trans-unit.target: From the <embeddedLabel>Receive Settings</embeddedLabel> tab, you can also promote properties from the SOAP and HTTP headers on the received message that can later be used during the agreement processing.

trans-unit.source: You can also use these properties for routing messages to their destinations.
trans-unit.target: You can also use these properties for routing messages to their destinations.

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>Receive Settings</embeddedLabel> tab is available only after the <embeddedLabel>General Settings</embeddedLabel> for a bridge are entered.
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>Receive Settings</embeddedLabel> tab is available only after the <embeddedLabel>General Settings</embeddedLabel> for a bridge are entered.

trans-unit.source: HTTP transport settings
trans-unit.target: HTTP transport settings

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Transport</ui> page, choose <ui>Http</ui> in the <legacyBold>Transport Type</legacyBold> drop down box.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Transport</ui> page, choose <ui>Http</ui> in the <legacyBold>Transport Type</legacyBold> drop down box.

trans-unit.source: The <ui>Endpoint</ui> URL is automatically populated with the address that is used to input messages to the Receive pipeline.
trans-unit.target: The <ui>Endpoint</ui> URL is automatically populated with the address that is used to input messages to the Receive pipeline.

trans-unit.source: You can keep the default GUID included in the URL or replace the GUID with another value of your choice.
trans-unit.target: You can keep the default GUID included in the URL or replace the GUID with another value of your choice.

trans-unit.source: The value you provide must be unique.
trans-unit.target: The value you provide must be unique.

trans-unit.source: This URL represents the endpoint at which the hosted partner receives a message from the guest partner.
trans-unit.target: This URL represents the endpoint at which the hosted partner receives a message from the guest partner.

trans-unit.source: FTP transport settings
trans-unit.target: FTP transport settings

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Transport</ui> page, choose <ui>FTP</ui> in the <legacyBold>Transport Type</legacyBold> drop down box.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Transport</ui> page, choose <ui>FTP</ui> in the <legacyBold>Transport Type</legacyBold> drop down box.

trans-unit.source: Enter your FTP server receive settings:
trans-unit.target: Enter your FTP server receive settings:

trans-unit.source: FTP Receive Setting
trans-unit.target: FTP Receive Setting

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: FTP server address
trans-unit.target: FTP server address

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: Enter the FTP server address that contains the messages.
trans-unit.target: Enter the FTP server address that contains the messages.

trans-unit.source: The <token>tpm_portal</token> looks for new messages dropped to a file location this server.
trans-unit.target: The <token>tpm_portal</token> looks for new messages dropped to a file location this server.

trans-unit.source: Port number
trans-unit.target: Port number

trans-unit.source: Enter the TCP port the FTP server is configured to use.
trans-unit.target: Enter the TCP port the FTP server is configured to use.

trans-unit.source: The default port is port 21.
trans-unit.target: The default port is port 21.

trans-unit.source: Username
trans-unit.target: Username

trans-unit.source: If the FTP server requires authentication, enter the username that the <token>tpm_portal</token> uses to connect to a file location on the FTP server.
trans-unit.target: If the FTP server requires authentication, enter the username that the <token>tpm_portal</token> uses to connect to a file location on the FTP server.

trans-unit.source: Password
trans-unit.target: Password

trans-unit.source: Enter the password for the username.
trans-unit.target: Enter the password for the username.

trans-unit.source: Confirm password
trans-unit.target: Confirm password

trans-unit.source: Re-enter the username password for the FTP server.
trans-unit.target: Re-enter the username password for the FTP server.

trans-unit.source: Relative path
trans-unit.target: Relative path

trans-unit.source: The relative path indicates the file location on the FTP server where the <token>tpm_portal</token> looks for messages.
trans-unit.target: The relative path indicates the file location on the FTP server where the <token>tpm_portal</token> looks for messages.

trans-unit.source: For example, enter <legacyBold>FTPIn</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: For example, enter <legacyBold>FTPIn</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: Do not include a backslash (\) in the relative path.
trans-unit.target: Do not include a backslash (\) in the relative path.

trans-unit.source: You must only provide the folder name where the message is received from.
trans-unit.target: You must only provide the folder name where the message is received from.

trans-unit.source: File mask
trans-unit.target: File mask

trans-unit.source: Enter a file mask to identify the message files on the FTP server.
trans-unit.target: Enter a file mask to identify the message files on the FTP server.

trans-unit.source: Transfer mode
trans-unit.target: Transfer mode

trans-unit.source: Choose whether messages are transferred from the server using <ui>BINARY</ui> or <ui>ASCII</ui> transfer mode.
trans-unit.target: Choose whether messages are transferred from the server using <ui>BINARY</ui> or <ui>ASCII</ui> transfer mode.

trans-unit.source: Always use <ui>BINARY</ui> if the messages are encrypted on the FTP server.
trans-unit.target: Always use <ui>BINARY</ui> if the messages are encrypted on the FTP server.

trans-unit.source: Use SSL
trans-unit.target: Use SSL

trans-unit.source: Uses SSL when communicating with the FTP server.
trans-unit.target: Uses SSL when communicating with the FTP server.

trans-unit.source: SFTP transport settings
trans-unit.target: SFTP transport settings

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Transport</ui> page, choose <ui>SFTP</ui> in the <legacyBold>Transport Type</legacyBold> drop down box.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Transport</ui> page, choose <ui>SFTP</ui> in the <legacyBold>Transport Type</legacyBold> drop down box.

trans-unit.source: Enter your SFTP server receive settings:
trans-unit.target: Enter your SFTP server receive settings:

trans-unit.source: SFTP Receive Setting
trans-unit.target: SFTP Receive Setting

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: SFTP server address
trans-unit.target: SFTP server address

trans-unit.source: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: <legacyBold>Required</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: Enter the SFTP server address that contains the messages.
trans-unit.target: Enter the SFTP server address that contains the messages.

trans-unit.source: The <token>tpm_portal</token> looks for new messages dropped to a file location this server.
trans-unit.target: The <token>tpm_portal</token> looks for new messages dropped to a file location this server.

trans-unit.source: Port number
trans-unit.target: Port number

trans-unit.source: Enter the TCP port used for communication.
trans-unit.target: Enter the TCP port used for communication.

trans-unit.source: The default port is port 22.
trans-unit.target: The default port is port 22.

trans-unit.source: Username
trans-unit.target: Username

trans-unit.source: If the SFTP server requires authentication, enter the username that the <token>tpm_portal</token> uses to connect to a location on the SFTP server.
trans-unit.target: If the SFTP server requires authentication, enter the username that the <token>tpm_portal</token> uses to connect to a location on the SFTP server.

trans-unit.source: Password
trans-unit.target: Password

trans-unit.source: Enter the password for the username.
trans-unit.target: Enter the password for the username.

trans-unit.source: Confirm password
trans-unit.target: Confirm password

trans-unit.source: Re-enter the username password for the SFTP server.
trans-unit.target: Re-enter the username password for the SFTP server.

trans-unit.source: Relative path
trans-unit.target: Relative path

trans-unit.source: The relative path indicates the file location on the SFTP server where the <token>tpm_portal</token> looks for messages.
trans-unit.target: The relative path indicates the file location on the SFTP server where the <token>tpm_portal</token> looks for messages.

trans-unit.source: For example, enter <legacyBold>FTPIn</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: For example, enter <legacyBold>FTPIn</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: Do not include a backslash (\) in the relative path.
trans-unit.target: Do not include a backslash (\) in the relative path.

trans-unit.source: You must only provide the folder name where the message is received from.
trans-unit.target: You must only provide the folder name where the message is received from.

trans-unit.source: File mask
trans-unit.target: File mask

trans-unit.source: Enter a file mask to identify the message files on the SFTP server.
trans-unit.target: Enter a file mask to identify the message files on the SFTP server.

trans-unit.source: AS2 transport settings
trans-unit.target: AS2 transport settings

trans-unit.source: To configure an AS2 transport, you must have already configured an AS2 agreement.
trans-unit.target: To configure an AS2 transport, you must have already configured an AS2 agreement.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="c437391b-9a64-4a18-bd8d-fc551be72bd4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Creating New AS2 Agreements</link> to create an AS2 agreement.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="c437391b-9a64-4a18-bd8d-fc551be72bd4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Creating New AS2 Agreements</link> to create an AS2 agreement.

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Transport</ui> page, choose <ui>AS2</ui> in the <legacyBold>Transport Type</legacyBold> drop down box.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Transport</ui> page, choose <ui>AS2</ui> in the <legacyBold>Transport Type</legacyBold> drop down box.

trans-unit.source: Select your AS2 agreement.
trans-unit.target: Select your AS2 agreement.

trans-unit.source: Promote SOAP and HTTP properties
trans-unit.target: Promote SOAP and HTTP properties

trans-unit.source: On the <embeddedLabel>Transport</embeddedLabel> page, expand the <embeddedLabel>Promoted Properties</embeddedLabel> section, and then select the (<embeddedLabel>+</embeddedLabel>) sign to promote a property.
trans-unit.target: On the <embeddedLabel>Transport</embeddedLabel> page, expand the <embeddedLabel>Promoted Properties</embeddedLabel> section, and then select the (<embeddedLabel>+</embeddedLabel>) sign to promote a property.

trans-unit.source: The following table details the fields and the values you must enter:
trans-unit.target: The following table details the fields and the values you must enter:

trans-unit.source: Field
trans-unit.target: Field

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Source Type
trans-unit.target: Source Type

trans-unit.source: Select the message type from which the header values are extracted.
trans-unit.target: Select the message type from which the header values are extracted.

trans-unit.source: For assigning header values to properties, the possible values are <userInput>SOAP</userInput> and <userInput>HTTP</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: For assigning header values to properties, the possible values are <userInput>SOAP</userInput> and <userInput>HTTP</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Property Name
trans-unit.target: Property Name

trans-unit.source: Enter the name of the property that you are defining.
trans-unit.target: Enter the name of the property that you are defining.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can set this to <embeddedLabel>MsgType</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can set this to <embeddedLabel>MsgType</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Identifier
trans-unit.target: Identifier

trans-unit.source: Enter the name of property present in the message header, the value of which you want to extract and assign to a property that you are defining.
trans-unit.target: Enter the name of property present in the message header, the value of which you want to extract and assign to a property that you are defining.

trans-unit.source: You can also promote the value of custom header properties.
trans-unit.target: You can also promote the value of custom header properties.

trans-unit.source: For example, in the following excerpt, <embeddedLabel>MessageType</embeddedLabel> is a custom header.
trans-unit.target: For example, in the following excerpt, <embeddedLabel>MessageType</embeddedLabel> is a custom header.

trans-unit.source: So, if you set the Identifier property <embeddedLabel>MessageType</embeddedLabel>, then the value of the header from the incoming message is extracted and is assigned to the <embeddedLabel>MsgType</embeddedLabel> property that you are defining as part of the agreement.
trans-unit.target: So, if you set the Identifier property <embeddedLabel>MessageType</embeddedLabel>, then the value of the header from the incoming message is extracted and is assigned to the <embeddedLabel>MsgType</embeddedLabel> property that you are defining as part of the agreement.

trans-unit.source: Namespace
trans-unit.target: Namespace

trans-unit.source: Specify the SOAP header namespace.
trans-unit.target: Specify the SOAP header namespace.

trans-unit.source: Going by the excerpt used above, the namespace for the <embeddedLabel>MessageType</embeddedLabel> custom header is highlighted.
trans-unit.target: Going by the excerpt used above, the namespace for the <embeddedLabel>MessageType</embeddedLabel> custom header is highlighted.

trans-unit.source: You do not need to provide a namespace if you are promoting a property from an HTTP message header.
trans-unit.target: You do not need to provide a namespace if you are promoting a property from an HTTP message header.

trans-unit.source: Configure the Transform
trans-unit.target: Configure the Transform

trans-unit.source: On the <embeddedLabel><token>transform</token></embeddedLabel> page, you can:
trans-unit.target: On the <embeddedLabel><token>transform</token></embeddedLabel> page, you can:

trans-unit.source: Upload an existing <token>transform</token> to map the incoming message to another message structure.
trans-unit.target: Upload an existing <token>transform</token> to map the incoming message to another message structure.

trans-unit.source: See <link xlink:href="e102686a-b1c5-467d-8f22-8fadec19189f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuring Transforms</link> to create a <token>transform</token>,.
trans-unit.target: See <link xlink:href="e102686a-b1c5-467d-8f22-8fadec19189f" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuring Transforms</link> to create a <token>transform</token>,.

trans-unit.source: If the <token>transform</token> uses a C# Scripting <token>mapop</token>, you can also upload the required assemblies as part of the agreement.
trans-unit.target: If the <token>transform</token> uses a C# Scripting <token>mapop</token>, you can also upload the required assemblies as part of the agreement.

trans-unit.source: On the <embeddedLabel><token>transform</token></embeddedLabel> page, you can promote properties on the incoming message based on XPath and Lookup queries.
trans-unit.target: On the <embeddedLabel><token>transform</token></embeddedLabel> page, you can promote properties on the incoming message based on XPath and Lookup queries.

trans-unit.source: Add a Transform
trans-unit.target: Add a Transform

trans-unit.source: Go to the <ui><token>transform</token>s</ui> page.
trans-unit.target: Go to the <ui><token>transform</token>s</ui> page.

trans-unit.source: If <token>transform</token>s are already uploaded, you can select the <token>transform</token> from the drop-down.
trans-unit.target: If <token>transform</token>s are already uploaded, you can select the <token>transform</token> from the drop-down.

trans-unit.source: If <token>transform</token>s have not been uploaded:
trans-unit.target: If <token>transform</token>s have not been uploaded:

trans-unit.source: Select <ui>Upload</ui> and browse for the <token>transform</token>.
trans-unit.target: Select <ui>Upload</ui> and browse for the <token>transform</token>.

trans-unit.source: In the dialog window, select the <token>transform</token> file (<legacyItalic>FileName</legacyItalic>.trfm), and select <ui>Open</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In the dialog window, select the <token>transform</token> file (<legacyItalic>FileName</legacyItalic>.trfm), and select <ui>Open</ui>.

trans-unit.source: The selected <token>transform</token> is added to the list of <token>transform</token>s.
trans-unit.target: The selected <token>transform</token> is added to the list of <token>transform</token>s.

trans-unit.source: Add an assembly
trans-unit.target: Add an assembly

trans-unit.source: If the <token>transform</token> you are using includes an external file assembly (.dll), then you must also upload the assembly:
trans-unit.target: If the <token>transform</token> you are using includes an external file assembly (.dll), then you must also upload the assembly:

trans-unit.source: Expand the <embeddedLabel>Assembly</embeddedLabel> section.
trans-unit.target: Expand the <embeddedLabel>Assembly</embeddedLabel> section.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>Upload</embeddedLabel> to browse to the .dll assembly.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>Upload</embeddedLabel> to browse to the .dll assembly.

trans-unit.source: Promote a Property
trans-unit.target: Promote a Property

trans-unit.source: On the <embeddedLabel><token>transform</token>s</embeddedLabel> page, expand the <embeddedLabel>Promoted Properties</embeddedLabel> section.
trans-unit.target: On the <embeddedLabel><token>transform</token>s</embeddedLabel> page, expand the <embeddedLabel>Promoted Properties</embeddedLabel> section.

trans-unit.source: The following options are available:
trans-unit.target: The following options are available:

trans-unit.source: Promote a property using XPath queries
trans-unit.target: Promote a property using XPath queries

trans-unit.source: Under the <embeddedLabel>XPath</embeddedLabel> section, for <embeddedLabel>Property Name</embeddedLabel>, enter the name of the property you are defining.
trans-unit.target: Under the <embeddedLabel>XPath</embeddedLabel> section, for <embeddedLabel>Property Name</embeddedLabel>, enter the name of the property you are defining.

trans-unit.source: The value of this property is set to the value that is extracted from the message body using the XPath query.
trans-unit.target: The value of this property is set to the value that is extracted from the message body using the XPath query.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Schema</embeddedLabel>, select the schema for the incoming message.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Schema</embeddedLabel>, select the schema for the incoming message.

trans-unit.source: If the schema is not listed, upload it by selecting <embeddedLabel>Upload</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: If the schema is not listed, upload it by selecting <embeddedLabel>Upload</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>XPath</embeddedLabel>, enter the XPath query to extract an element or an attribute from a message.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>XPath</embeddedLabel>, enter the XPath query to extract an element or an attribute from a message.

trans-unit.source: A typical XPath query looks like the following:
trans-unit.target: A typical XPath query looks like the following:

trans-unit.source: You can get an XPath query from the schema editor.
trans-unit.target: You can get an XPath query from the schema editor.

trans-unit.source: In the Schema Editor available as part of the <token>msgflow_proj</token>, select the schema element for which you want the XPath query.
trans-unit.target: In the Schema Editor available as part of the <token>msgflow_proj</token>, select the schema element for which you want the XPath query.

trans-unit.source: In the Properties window, look for the value of the <embeddedLabel>Instance Xpath</embeddedLabel> property.
trans-unit.target: In the Properties window, look for the value of the <embeddedLabel>Instance Xpath</embeddedLabel> property.

trans-unit.source: That should be the XPath query for the node.
trans-unit.target: That should be the XPath query for the node.

trans-unit.source: Promote a property using lookup
trans-unit.target: Promote a property using lookup

trans-unit.source: Under the <embeddedLabel>Lookup</embeddedLabel> section, for <embeddedLabel>Property Name</embeddedLabel>, enter the name of the property you are defining.
trans-unit.target: Under the <embeddedLabel>Lookup</embeddedLabel> section, for <embeddedLabel>Property Name</embeddedLabel>, enter the name of the property you are defining.

trans-unit.source: The value of this property is set to the value extracted using the lookup configuration you are defining.
trans-unit.target: The value of this property is set to the value extracted using the lookup configuration you are defining.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Connection URL</embeddedLabel>, enter a valid connection URL to connect to a <token>ssNoVersion</token>.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Connection URL</embeddedLabel>, enter a valid connection URL to connect to a <token>ssNoVersion</token>.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Table Name</embeddedLabel>, enter the <token>ssNoVersion</token> table name to query.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Table Name</embeddedLabel>, enter the <token>ssNoVersion</token> table name to query.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Query Out Column</embeddedLabel>, enter a column name in the <token>ssNoVersion</token> table.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Query Out Column</embeddedLabel>, enter a column name in the <token>ssNoVersion</token> table.

trans-unit.source: This value is used as the output value that gets assigned to the looked up property.
trans-unit.target: This value is used as the output value that gets assigned to the looked up property.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Query In Column</embeddedLabel>, enter a column name in the <token>ssNoVersion</token> table.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Query In Column</embeddedLabel>, enter a column name in the <token>ssNoVersion</token> table.

trans-unit.source: This value is used as the input query for performing the data lookup.
trans-unit.target: This value is used as the input query for performing the data lookup.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Input Property</embeddedLabel>, select a property.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Input Property</embeddedLabel>, select a property.

trans-unit.source: The value of this property is passed to the <embeddedLabel>Query In Column</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The value of this property is passed to the <embeddedLabel>Query In Column</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: To understand how Lookup is used at run-time, assume a <embeddedLabel>TempTable</embeddedLabel> table exists in a <token>ssNoVersion</token> database.
trans-unit.target: To understand how Lookup is used at run-time, assume a <embeddedLabel>TempTable</embeddedLabel> table exists in a <token>ssNoVersion</token> database.

trans-unit.source: This table has two columns: <embeddedLabel>PurchaseOrder</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>CustomerName</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: This table has two columns: <embeddedLabel>PurchaseOrder</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>CustomerName</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Lets assume that you previously promoted a property called <embeddedLabel>P1</embeddedLabel> as part of the agreement.
trans-unit.target: Lets assume that you previously promoted a property called <embeddedLabel>P1</embeddedLabel> as part of the agreement.

trans-unit.source: PropertyName
trans-unit.target: PropertyName

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>P2</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>P2</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: This is the property that contains the value promoted using a Lookup.
trans-unit.target: This is the property that contains the value promoted using a Lookup.

trans-unit.source: TableName
trans-unit.target: TableName

trans-unit.source: TempTable
trans-unit.target: TempTable

trans-unit.source: Query In Column
trans-unit.target: Query In Column

trans-unit.source: PurchaseOrder
trans-unit.target: PurchaseOrder

trans-unit.source: Query Out Column
trans-unit.target: Query Out Column

trans-unit.source: CustomerName
trans-unit.target: CustomerName

trans-unit.source: Input Query
trans-unit.target: Input Query

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>P1</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>P1</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: You could have promoted this property earlier either using XPath or from the SOAP or HTTP message header.
trans-unit.target: You could have promoted this property earlier either using XPath or from the SOAP or HTTP message header.

trans-unit.source: Assume the value of P1, at runtime, is set to <embeddedLabel>PO1234</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Assume the value of P1, at runtime, is set to <embeddedLabel>PO1234</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: This is how the configuration is used:
trans-unit.target: This is how the configuration is used:

trans-unit.source: The agreement looks up the value of P1 (<embeddedLabel>PO1234</embeddedLabel>) in the input query column (<embeddedLabel>PurchaseOrder</embeddedLabel>) in the table (<embeddedLabel>TempTable</embeddedLabel>).
trans-unit.target: The agreement looks up the value of P1 (<embeddedLabel>PO1234</embeddedLabel>) in the input query column (<embeddedLabel>PurchaseOrder</embeddedLabel>) in the table (<embeddedLabel>TempTable</embeddedLabel>).

trans-unit.source: The agreement then picks up the value corresponding to <embeddedLabel>PO1234</embeddedLabel> from the output query column (<embeddedLabel>CustomerName</embeddedLabel>) in the <embeddedLabel>TempTable</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The agreement then picks up the value corresponding to <embeddedLabel>PO1234</embeddedLabel> from the output query column (<embeddedLabel>CustomerName</embeddedLabel>) in the <embeddedLabel>TempTable</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The value picked up from the output query column is assigned to the property P2.
trans-unit.target: The value picked up from the output query column is assigned to the property P2.

trans-unit.source: For example, if the customer name corresponding to purchase order <embeddedLabel>PO1234</embeddedLabel> is <embeddedLabel>John</embeddedLabel>, then the value of P2 is set to John.
trans-unit.target: For example, if the customer name corresponding to purchase order <embeddedLabel>PO1234</embeddedLabel> is <embeddedLabel>John</embeddedLabel>, then the value of P2 is set to John.

trans-unit.source: Configure the Route
trans-unit.target: Configure the Route

trans-unit.source: Use the <embeddedLabel>Route</embeddedLabel> page to:
trans-unit.target: Use the <embeddedLabel>Route</embeddedLabel> page to:

trans-unit.source: Set route conditions/rules based on which messages are routed to destination endpoints.
trans-unit.target: Set route conditions/rules based on which messages are routed to destination endpoints.

trans-unit.source: Set route actions.
trans-unit.target: Set route actions.

trans-unit.source: Route actions can be used to include specific message headers (for SOAP and HTTP) before the message is sent to the destination endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Route actions can be used to include specific message headers (for SOAP and HTTP) before the message is sent to the destination endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Set route destinations for messages that are successfully processed or get suspended.
trans-unit.target: Set route destinations for messages that are successfully processed or get suspended.

trans-unit.source: Set message suspensions settings for routing a suspended message to a <token>af_integration</token><token>bridge</token>, <token>Azure_2</token> Blobs, or <token>Azure_2</token><token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: Set message suspensions settings for routing a suspended message to a <token>af_integration</token><token>bridge</token>, <token>Azure_2</token> Blobs, or <token>Azure_2</token><token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: Route Settings
trans-unit.target: Route Settings

trans-unit.source: On the <ui>Route</ui> page, expand <embeddedLabel>Route Settings</embeddedLabel>, select the <embeddedLabel>Route acks as flat file</embeddedLabel> checkbox to receive a flat-file acknowledgement from the trading partner.
trans-unit.target: On the <ui>Route</ui> page, expand <embeddedLabel>Route Settings</embeddedLabel>, select the <embeddedLabel>Route acks as flat file</embeddedLabel> checkbox to receive a flat-file acknowledgement from the trading partner.

trans-unit.source: Click <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Click <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>New Route Rule</embeddedLabel> dialog box, you specify three key routing configurations routing condition, routing action, and routing destination.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>New Route Rule</embeddedLabel> dialog box, you specify three key routing configurations routing condition, routing action, and routing destination.

trans-unit.source: Specify a unique name for the routing rule.
trans-unit.target: Specify a unique name for the routing rule.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Route Rule</embeddedLabel>: Specify the routing condition based on the properties you promoted earlier.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Route Rule</embeddedLabel>: Specify the routing condition based on the properties you promoted earlier.

trans-unit.source: You can either use the grid to specify the condition or provide a SQL 92 filter expression that specifies the condition.
trans-unit.target: You can either use the grid to specify the condition or provide a SQL 92 filter expression that specifies the condition.

trans-unit.source: To understand this better, let us assume you promoted a property (<embeddedLabel>CustName</embeddedLabel>) whose value is set to <embeddedLabel>John</embeddedLabel> at runtime.
trans-unit.target: To understand this better, let us assume you promoted a property (<embeddedLabel>CustName</embeddedLabel>) whose value is set to <embeddedLabel>John</embeddedLabel> at runtime.

trans-unit.source: To use this property as a routing condition, you can do either of the following:
trans-unit.target: To use this property as a routing condition, you can do either of the following:

trans-unit.source: Select the option for the grid, and then click the (<embeddedLabel>+</embeddedLabel>) icon to select the property you promoted.
trans-unit.target: Select the option for the grid, and then click the (<embeddedLabel>+</embeddedLabel>) icon to select the property you promoted.

trans-unit.source: From the grid, select <embeddedLabel>CustName</embeddedLabel>, specify the <embeddedLabel>Operation</embeddedLabel> as (<embeddedLabel>==</embeddedLabel>), and set the value to <userInput>John</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: From the grid, select <embeddedLabel>CustName</embeddedLabel>, specify the <embeddedLabel>Operation</embeddedLabel> as (<embeddedLabel>==</embeddedLabel>), and set the value to <userInput>John</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: OR
trans-unit.target: OR

trans-unit.source: Select the <embeddedLabel>Use advanced definitions</embeddedLabel> option, and specify a SQL 92 expression, such as:
trans-unit.target: Select the <embeddedLabel>Use advanced definitions</embeddedLabel> option, and specify a SQL 92 expression, such as:

trans-unit.source: You can use this option to provide more detailed query expressions using other operators as well.
trans-unit.target: You can use this option to provide more detailed query expressions using other operators as well.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Route action</embeddedLabel>: If the route condition is met, at runtime the agreement stamps message headers based on the route actions you specify here.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Route action</embeddedLabel>: If the route condition is met, at runtime the agreement stamps message headers based on the route actions you specify here.

trans-unit.source: Under <embeddedLabel>Route action</embeddedLabel>, click the (<embeddedLabel>+</embeddedLabel>) icon, and specify the following values.
trans-unit.target: Under <embeddedLabel>Route action</embeddedLabel>, click the (<embeddedLabel>+</embeddedLabel>) icon, and specify the following values.

trans-unit.source: Field Name
trans-unit.target: Field Name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Target Type
trans-unit.target: Target Type

trans-unit.source: Set this to SOAP or HTTP.
trans-unit.target: Set this to SOAP or HTTP.

trans-unit.source: Header
trans-unit.target: Header

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of message header property to which a value will be assigned.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of message header property to which a value will be assigned.

trans-unit.source: You can also specify custom headers here.
trans-unit.target: You can also specify custom headers here.

trans-unit.source: Namespace
trans-unit.target: Namespace

trans-unit.source: Specify the namespace of the SOAP header to which the value will be assigned.
trans-unit.target: Specify the namespace of the SOAP header to which the value will be assigned.

trans-unit.source: This field is disabled if you set the <embeddedLabel>Target Type</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>HTTP</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: This field is disabled if you set the <embeddedLabel>Target Type</embeddedLabel> to <embeddedLabel>HTTP</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Value Type
trans-unit.target: Value Type

trans-unit.source: Select <userInput>Constant</userInput> if you want to assign a constant value to the header property.
trans-unit.target: Select <userInput>Constant</userInput> if you want to assign a constant value to the header property.

trans-unit.source: Select <userInput>PromotedProperty</userInput> if you want to the value of a promoted property to the header property.
trans-unit.target: Select <userInput>PromotedProperty</userInput> if you want to the value of a promoted property to the header property.

trans-unit.source: Constant Value
trans-unit.target: Constant Value

trans-unit.source: If you set <embeddedLabel>Value Type</embeddedLabel> to <userInput>Constant</userInput>, specify the constant value that must be assigned to the message header property.
trans-unit.target: If you set <embeddedLabel>Value Type</embeddedLabel> to <userInput>Constant</userInput>, specify the constant value that must be assigned to the message header property.

trans-unit.source: Promoted Property
trans-unit.target: Promoted Property

trans-unit.source: If you set <embeddedLabel>Value Type</embeddedLabel> to <userInput>PromotedProperty</userInput>, selected the property whose value is assigned to the message header property.
trans-unit.target: If you set <embeddedLabel>Value Type</embeddedLabel> to <userInput>PromotedProperty</userInput>, selected the property whose value is assigned to the message header property.

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Route destination</embeddedLabel>: Specify the destination where the messages are routed once they are processed by the agreement:
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Route destination</embeddedLabel>: Specify the destination where the messages are routed once they are processed by the agreement:

trans-unit.source: Even if you do not specify a routing condition and a routing action, you must specify a routing destination.
trans-unit.target: Even if you do not specify a routing condition and a routing action, you must specify a routing destination.

trans-unit.source: Azure BizTalk Bridge
trans-unit.target: Azure BizTalk Bridge

trans-unit.source: Enter the name of the <token>bridge</token> to route the message.
trans-unit.target: Enter the name of the <token>bridge</token> to route the message.

trans-unit.source: The URL looks similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: The URL looks similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: https://<legacyItalic>YourDeployment</legacyItalic>.biztalk.windows.net/default/<legacyItalic>BridgeName</legacyItalic>
trans-unit.target: https://<legacyItalic>YourDeployment</legacyItalic>.biztalk.windows.net/default/<legacyItalic>BridgeName</legacyItalic>

trans-unit.source: Azure Blobs
trans-unit.target: Azure Blobs

trans-unit.source: Enter the <ui>Shared Access Signature URL</ui> to your <token>Azure_2</token> Blob.
trans-unit.target: Enter the <ui>Shared Access Signature URL</ui> to your <token>Azure_2</token> Blob.

trans-unit.source: For example, enter:
trans-unit.target: For example, enter:

trans-unit.source: https://<legacyItalic>myAccount</legacyItalic>.blob.core.windows.net/<legacyItalic>ContainerName</legacyItalic>/<legacyItalic>BlobName</legacyItalic><legacyItalic>PolicyIndentifier</legacyItalic><legacyItalic>Signature</legacyItalic>
trans-unit.target: https://<legacyItalic>myAccount</legacyItalic>.blob.core.windows.net/<legacyItalic>ContainerName</legacyItalic>/<legacyItalic>BlobName</legacyItalic><legacyItalic>PolicyIndentifier</legacyItalic><legacyItalic>Signature</legacyItalic>

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>Managing Access to Containers, Blobs, Tables, and Queues</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=273871</linkUri></externalLink> provides more information on the <ui>Shared Access Signature URL</ui>.
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>Managing Access to Containers, Blobs, Tables, and Queues</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=273871</linkUri></externalLink> provides more information on the <ui>Shared Access Signature URL</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Azure <token>sb2</token>
trans-unit.target: Azure <token>sb2</token>

trans-unit.source: You can route to any of the following <token>sb2</token> entities.
trans-unit.target: You can route to any of the following <token>sb2</token> entities.

trans-unit.source: Queue
trans-unit.target: Queue

trans-unit.source: Provide either the Shared Access Signature (SAS) or the shared secret for the queue.
trans-unit.target: Provide either the Shared Access Signature (SAS) or the shared secret for the queue.

trans-unit.source: If you choose the SAS option, provide the SAS connection string and the name of the queue to route to.
trans-unit.target: If you choose the SAS option, provide the SAS connection string and the name of the queue to route to.

trans-unit.source: If you choose the shared secret name, provide the URL for the queue, <token>sb2</token> issuer name, and <token>sb2</token> issuer key.
trans-unit.target: If you choose the shared secret name, provide the URL for the queue, <token>sb2</token> issuer name, and <token>sb2</token> issuer key.

trans-unit.source: Topic
trans-unit.target: Topic

trans-unit.source: Provide either the Shared Access Signature (SAS) or the shared secret for the topic.
trans-unit.target: Provide either the Shared Access Signature (SAS) or the shared secret for the topic.

trans-unit.source: If you choose the SAS option, provide the SAS connection string and the name of the topic to route to.
trans-unit.target: If you choose the SAS option, provide the SAS connection string and the name of the topic to route to.

trans-unit.source: If you choose the shared secret name, provide the URL for the topic, <token>sb2</token> issuer name, and <token>sb2</token> issuer key.
trans-unit.target: If you choose the shared secret name, provide the URL for the topic, <token>sb2</token> issuer name, and <token>sb2</token> issuer key.

trans-unit.source: BasicHttpRelay
trans-unit.target: BasicHttpRelay

trans-unit.source: Provide the URL for the relay endpoint, the <token>sb2</token> issuer name, and the <token>sb2</token> issuer key.
trans-unit.target: Provide the URL for the relay endpoint, the <token>sb2</token> issuer name, and the <token>sb2</token> issuer key.

trans-unit.source: WebHttpRelay
trans-unit.target: WebHttpRelay

trans-unit.source: Provide the URL for the relay endpoint, the <token>sb2</token> issuer name, and the <token>sb2</token> issuer key.
trans-unit.target: Provide the URL for the relay endpoint, the <token>sb2</token> issuer name, and the <token>sb2</token> issuer key.

trans-unit.source: NetTcpRelay
trans-unit.target: NetTcpRelay

trans-unit.source: Provide the URL for the relay endpoint, the <token>sb2</token> issuer name, and the <token>sb2</token> issuer key.
trans-unit.target: Provide the URL for the relay endpoint, the <token>sb2</token> issuer name, and the <token>sb2</token> issuer key.

trans-unit.source: If you choose to route to a <token>sb2</token> relay endpoint, make sure the relay endpoint hosts a two-way relay service.
trans-unit.target: If you choose to route to a <token>sb2</token> relay endpoint, make sure the relay endpoint hosts a two-way relay service.

trans-unit.source: You cannot use EDI pipelines to route to a one-way relay service.
trans-unit.target: You cannot use EDI pipelines to route to a one-way relay service.

trans-unit.source: Click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel> to save the route settings.
trans-unit.target: Click <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel> to save the route settings.

trans-unit.source: If more than one route rules are defined, evaluation is based on the first match.
trans-unit.target: If more than one route rules are defined, evaluation is based on the first match.

trans-unit.source: The order of executing the rules is defined by the order in which the rules are defined in the grid.
trans-unit.target: The order of executing the rules is defined by the order in which the rules are defined in the grid.

trans-unit.source: Message Suspension Settings
trans-unit.target: Message Suspension Settings

trans-unit.source: Any messages that fail processing can be routed to various endpoints as well.
trans-unit.target: Any messages that fail processing can be routed to various endpoints as well.

trans-unit.source: The following table provides the where failed messages can be routed to:
trans-unit.target: The following table provides the where failed messages can be routed to:

trans-unit.source: Azure BizTalk Bridge
trans-unit.target: Azure BizTalk Bridge

trans-unit.source: Enter the name of the <token>bridge</token> to route the message.
trans-unit.target: Enter the name of the <token>bridge</token> to route the message.

trans-unit.source: The URL looks similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: The URL looks similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: https://<legacyItalic>YourDeployment</legacyItalic>.biztalk.windows.net/default/<legacyItalic>BridgeName</legacyItalic>
trans-unit.target: https://<legacyItalic>YourDeployment</legacyItalic>.biztalk.windows.net/default/<legacyItalic>BridgeName</legacyItalic>

trans-unit.source: Azure Blobs
trans-unit.target: Azure Blobs

trans-unit.source: Enter the <ui>Shared Access Signature URL</ui> to your <token>Azure_2</token> Blob.
trans-unit.target: Enter the <ui>Shared Access Signature URL</ui> to your <token>Azure_2</token> Blob.

trans-unit.source: For example, enter:
trans-unit.target: For example, enter:

trans-unit.source: https://<legacyItalic>myAccount</legacyItalic>.blob.core.windows.net/<legacyItalic>ContainerName</legacyItalic>/<legacyItalic>BlobName</legacyItalic><legacyItalic>PolicyIndentifier</legacyItalic><legacyItalic>Signature</legacyItalic>
trans-unit.target: https://<legacyItalic>myAccount</legacyItalic>.blob.core.windows.net/<legacyItalic>ContainerName</legacyItalic>/<legacyItalic>BlobName</legacyItalic><legacyItalic>PolicyIndentifier</legacyItalic><legacyItalic>Signature</legacyItalic>

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>Managing Access to Containers, Blobs, Tables, and Queues</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=273871</linkUri></externalLink> provides more information on the <ui>Shared Access Signature URL</ui>.
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>Managing Access to Containers, Blobs, Tables, and Queues</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkID=273871</linkUri></externalLink> provides more information on the <ui>Shared Access Signature URL</ui>.
